image.alt: Lawton Orthodontics team welcoming patients in modern office

paragraphs.text: Our orthodontic practice is dedicated to providing service that exceeds our patients’ expectations in a fun, caring, and professional atmosphere. As a father-and-son team (Dr. Thomas Lawton and Dr. Brett Lawton), together with Dr. Mark Angeloni and our experienced staff, we take the time to talk with each patient at every appointment to make sure you’re comfortable with your treatment and that all questions are answered. We offer complimentary consultations and a comprehensive suite of orthodontic services for children, teens, and adults in Winter Park and Oviedo.

items.title: Family-First Care
items.text: Personalized, family-first care from a father-and-son practice that emphasizes comfort, clear communication, and individualized treatment plans.

items.title: Advanced Technology
items.text: We use iTero digital impressions, i-CAT 3D imaging, AcceleDent, and other modern tools to improve diagnostics and patient comfort.

items.title: Clinical Excellence
items.text: Authorized providers of the Damon™ system and experienced in Invisalign<sup>®</sup> clear aligner therapy, offering clinically driven options tailored to each patient.

items.title: Patient Logistics
items.text: Two convenient offices in Winter Park and Oviedo, transparent financial guidance, and online patient forms to simplify new-patient onboarding.

Home.title: Meet Brett T. Lawton, DMD, MS

paragraphs.text: Dr. Brett Lawton is a central Florida native who provides modern orthodontic care with an emphasis on patient comfort and clear communication. He earned his bachelor’s degree from Vanderbilt University and his Doctorate of Dental Medicine with honors from the University of Kentucky; he completed his orthodontic residency and Master of Science at the University of Florida, including research comparing traditional treatment and Invisalign.

Home.title: Meet Thomas C. Lawton, DMD, MS

paragraphs.text: Dr. Thomas Lawton has practiced in Winter Park since 1973 and provides decades of clinical leadership to the practice. He is board certified and a Diplomate of the American Board of Orthodontics, and he brings long-standing community service and experience to every case.

Home.title: Meet Mark D. Angeloni, DMD, MSD

paragraphs.text: Dr. Mark Angeloni combines mechanical engineering training with orthodontic expertise to design functional, beautiful smiles. He earned a BS in Mechanical Engineering (summa cum laude) from Union College, his DMD from the University of Connecticut, and his Orthodontic Certificate and MSD from the Medical University of South Carolina.
From clear aligners to modern self-ligating braces, we offer treatment options for children, teens, and adults tailored to individual needs.

testimonials.author: Judy C.
testimonials.testimonial: “Can’t say enough about Dr. Lawton and his entire staff. Tremendous care and expertise every step of the way. The atmosphere is great and they are SUPER kid-friendly. From the first time we visited, it is clear they care about each and every patient as if they are family. Thank you to every member of their team!”

testimonials.author: Naomi R.
testimonials.testimonial: “Both Drs. Lawton are very knowledgeable and allow their patients to completely understand each step of the process. They are authorized providers of the Damon braces system... The office runs like clockwork and is very friendly.”

testimonials.author: Ana T.
testimonials.testimonial: “Dr. Brett Lawton and his team are the absolute best!!! He is taking care of my entire family, and has been so wonderful with my daughter... I trust them completely. I cannot imagine being at another facility. Dr. Lawton is a GEM in the industry!!”

testimonials.author: Matt B.
testimonials.testimonial: “What can I say except a FANTASTIC experience every time you walk in the office where everyone greets you with a smile, asks you how you are doing, and always on time. Absolutely love the office and entire staff.”

image.alt: Parents with kids relaxing in front of home

og_meta.title: Home - Lawton Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Family-focused orthodontic care in Winter Park and Oviedo. Complimentary consults and modern treatment options including Invisalign® and Damon™.

image.alt: Lawton Orthodontics team smiling in a bright office lobby

paragraphs.text: Our orthodontic practice is dedicated to providing service that exceeds our patients’ expectations in a fun, caring, and professional atmosphere. As a father-and-son team and with our experienced staff, we are committed to making each patient feel special.

We take the time to talk with each patient at every appointment, make sure you’re comfortable with the treatment, and answer any questions patients or parents may have. We strive to provide a friendly, inviting, professional environment; be efficient with your time and money; and offer the latest orthodontic technology, including AcceleDent Aura and iTero digital impressions, to deliver the best possible patient experience.

Dr. Brett Lawton is a central Florida native. He earned his DMD with honors from the University of Kentucky and completed a three-year orthodontic residency at the University of Florida, where he also received a Master of Science for research comparing traditional orthodontic treatment and Invisalign. He brings extensive training in adult and pediatric orthodontics, complex craniofacial cases, and contemporary techniques.

image.alt: Dr. Brett Lawton smiling in clinic

paragraphs.text: Dr. Lawton received his bachelor’s degree from Vanderbilt University and his Doctorate of Dental Medicine with honors from the University of Kentucky. He completed his orthodontic residency at the University of Florida, earning a Master of Science. He holds advanced Invisalign training and is an active member of the American Association of Orthodontists, Southern Association of Orthodontists, Florida Association of Orthodontists, and American Dental Association.

image.alt: Dr. Brett Lawton in treatment room

paragraphs.text: Dr. Lawton lives in Orlando with his wife Laura and three children. He enjoys water sports, playing guitar, and fishing. He is passionate about delivering modern, compassionate orthodontic care to his community and helping patients of all ages feel confident about their smiles.

Dr. Tom Lawton is a fourth-generation Floridian who has practiced in Winter Park since 1973. He completed his dental degree with honors at the University of Kentucky and advanced orthodontic training there as well. He has served as senior dental officer at a U.S. Coast Guard base, taught part-time at the University of Florida College of Dentistry, and led the Florida Association of Orthodontists as past president.

Dr. Tom completed undergraduate studies at the University of Florida and his Doctorate of Dental Medicine with honors at the University of Kentucky. He completed a hospital internship in Boston and his orthodontic residency at the University of Kentucky, where he also earned a Master of Science. He is board certified and has been a Diplomate of the American Board of Orthodontics since 1985.
Dr. Lawton is married and proud to practice alongside his son, Dr. Brett Lawton. Outside the office he enjoys family time and remains active in local professional and community efforts.

Dr. Mark Angeloni trained first in mechanical engineering before pursuing dentistry. He blends engineering precision with clinical skill to design functional, beautiful smiles and deliver life-changing results while prioritizing a positive patient experience.

image.alt: Dr. Mark Angeloni in the office

paragraphs.text: Dr. Angeloni holds a B.S. summa cum laude in Mechanical Engineering from Union College, a DMD from the University of Connecticut, and his Orthodontic Certificate and M.S. in Dentistry from the Medical University of South Carolina. His background gives him a unique perspective on biomechanics and smile design.

Dr. Angeloni lives with his wife Ana and their sons. He enjoys training for triathlons, baking, and playing drums, and he values giving patients efficient, compassionate care that improves daily life.

seo.page_description: Learn about Lawton Orthodontics — our mission, experienced doctors, and team serving Winter Park and Oviedo with advanced orthodontic care.
seo.page_keywords: Lawton Orthodontics, Orthodontics, Winter Park, Oviedo, Invisalign, Braces

og_meta.title: About Us | Lawton Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Meet our doctors and team at Lawton Orthodontics. We offer family-focused orthodontic care with modern technology in Winter Park and Oviedo.

image.alt: Smiling family welcomed at Lawton Orthodontics front desk

paragraphs.text: Every smile starts with an initial consultation. Your first visit gives you a chance to meet our team, receive a complete oral exam (with X-rays if needed), and learn which treatment options will best meet your needs.
We review your dental and medical history, create a customized treatment plan, and discuss financing, insurance, and payment options so your care fits both your goals and your budget.

image.alt: Parent and child checking in at orthodontic reception

paragraphs.text: We accept most major insurance plans and will file your claims electronically for maximum convenience.
Flexible payment plans are available. Our treatment coordinator will help you choose an option that fits your budget so care is affordable.
Before your appointment, please complete your patient forms online or download them to fill out at home. Returning completed forms at check-in helps us focus on your exam and treatment planning.

image.alt: Patient filling out orthodontic health history forms online

seo.page_description: Start your orthodontic journey with Lawton Orthodontics. Learn what to expect at your first visit, access patient forms, and schedule a consultation.
seo.page_keywords: orthodontics, new patient, patient forms, Lawton Orthodontics, Winter Park, Oviedo

og_meta.title: Get Started | Lawton Orthodontics
og_meta.description: Learn what to expect at your first visit, access patient forms, and schedule your consultation with Lawton Orthodontics in Winter Park and Oviedo.

image.alt: Smiling patients of all ages receiving orthodontic care in a bright office

paragraphs.text: Invisalign<sup>®</sup> uses a series of clear, removable aligners to straighten teeth with precision and minimal disruption to your life. Aligners are custom-planned with digital 3D imaging so we can predict tooth movement and help you see likely results before treatment begins.
Because the aligners are removable, you can keep brushing and flossing normally and eat the foods you love while progressing toward a healthier, more confident smile.

image.alt: Close-up of clear aligners being placed on teeth

paragraphs.text: Damon™ Smile braces are a passive, self-ligating system that uses a slide mechanism instead of elastic ties. That means gentler forces, fewer adjustments, and often a faster, more comfortable treatment experience.
Patients benefit from improved comfort, easier hygiene, and the option of clear brackets for a more discreet look during treatment.

image.alt: Close-up of orthodontic brackets and archwire on teeth

paragraphs.text: Traditional metal braces remain a reliable, cost-effective way to correct a wide range of orthodontic issues. For patients who want a less noticeable option, ceramic (clear) brackets blend with the tooth color while still delivering precise results.

image.alt: Two smiling teens, one wearing braces, taking a selfie

paragraphs.text: The Herbst appliance is often used alongside braces to encourage forward growth of the lower jaw in growing patients. It is fixed to the molars and gently guides jaw development to improve bite relationships.
Treatment with a Herbst appliance commonly lasts about 12 months, though timing varies by the child’s individual growth and treatment plan.

image.alt: Young patient receiving early orthodontic evaluation

paragraphs.text: Two‑phase (early/interceptive) treatment combines early correction of jaw and bite development with a later phase of comprehensive alignment. Phase One creates room for permanent teeth and addresses growth-related issues so Phase Two can focus on precise positioning.
Starting at the right time can reduce the need for extractions or more invasive procedures later. We’ll make records—photos, X-rays, and models—to determine the best timing for your child.

image.alt: Smiling family spending time together, representing all-ages orthodontic care

paragraphs.text: A palatal expander widens the upper jaw by applying gentle, controlled pressure to the upper molars. This can correct narrow jaws and create space for erupting permanent teeth.
We provide step-by-step adjustment instructions and a printable guide you can download for reference: https://www.sesamehub.com/sesame_media/docs/palatal-expander.pdf

image.alt: Orthodontic appliance model and digital imaging tools

paragraphs.text: ULAB aligners are a clear, removable option fabricated from in-office digital scans. We capture an accurate digital impression, print models with our SprintRay 3D printer, and produce aligners tailored to your treatment plan.
Clear aligners are effective for many cases, though not every patient is a candidate. Schedule a consultation to learn whether ULAB is right for you.

image.alt: Digital intraoral scanner capturing a 3D image of teeth

paragraphs.text: Surgical orthodontics (orthognathic surgery) is used when jaw discrepancies require surgical correction in addition to braces. We coordinate closely with oral and maxillofacial surgeons to plan each step for improved function, airway, and facial balance.
Treatment typically combines presurgical orthodontics, the surgical procedure, and postoperative orthodontic finishing to achieve stable, long-term results.

image.alt: Orthodontic surgical consultation with clinician reviewing treatment plan

image.alt: Patient smiling with orthodontic braces in our Emeryville office

paragraphs.text: Find answers to common questions about treatments, insurance and billing, appointment scheduling, and what to expect during care at Lawton Orthodontics.

accordion.header: What orthodontic treatments do you offer?

paragraphs.text: We offer a full range of orthodontic options for kids, teens, and adults, including traditional metal braces, ceramic braces, and clear aligner therapy such as Invisalign<sup>®</sup>. At your consultation we’ll review which option best fits your goals and lifestyle.

accordion.header: At what age should my child see an orthodontist?

paragraphs.text: We follow the American Association of Orthodontists’ guidance to evaluate children by age seven. Early evaluation lets us spot growth patterns and, when appropriate, begin early treatment or monitor development over time.

accordion.header: How long does treatment usually take?

paragraphs.text: Treatment length depends on the complexity of the case and the chosen appliance. Many patients complete active treatment in about 12 to 24 months. We’ll give you a personalized timeline after the initial exam and imaging.

accordion.header: What payment and insurance options are available?

paragraphs.text: We accept most major dental insurance plans and offer flexible monthly financing to fit family budgets. Our front desk will help you estimate benefits and set up a payment plan that works for you.

accordion.header: How can I schedule an appointment?

paragraphs.text: You can request an appointment online or contact the office directly. Visit our Winter Park office page (https://www.lawtonorthodontics.com/winter-park-office) or Oviedo office page (https://www.lawtonorthodontics.com/oviedo-office) for location details and the quickest ways to reach each office.
